person.persName: Asa B. Gardner (Warren County, Kentucky, soldier and farmer)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, soldier and farmer. Virginia native. Son of Thomas Gardner and Sarah Wadkins Gardner. Married to Amelia Bowles Gardner. Father of Jemima Day Gardner Smith, Angeline Gardner, Ira T. Gardner, Lewis Gardner, and Elizabeth Gardner. Married to Jane Keel Gardner in Warren County, Kentucky, on February 22, 1847. Married to America R. Elam Batts Gardner in Rutherford County, Tennessee, on March 7, 1850. Father of Minerva Gardner, Asa B. Gardner, Rachel Gardner, and Ella E. Gardner. Served in the 7th Virginia Militia as a private and captain from August 26, 1814, to February 25, 1815. Resident in Warren County in 1820. Owned one enslaved person in Warren County in 1820. Resident in Edmonson County, Kentucky, in 1830. Owned two enslaved persons in Edmonson County in 1830. Farmer in Edmonson County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Edmonson County in 1850. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Employed H. Shackleford in Warren County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860.
